Detailed Description

A simple implementation of logging, that outputs to stderr with time stamps.

org::ipdr::collector::log::CollectorLog::CollectorLog (  String  linePrefix  )  [inline]
 

The constructor.

Parameters:
linePrefix A string to prefix on each output line (handy for things such as the "progress" callback for CollectorSetupManager, to allow distinguishing a set of log outputs). 
00041     {
00042         this.linePrefix = linePrefix;
00043         Package pkg = this.getClass().getPackage();
00044         if (pkg == null)
00045         {
00046             pkgPrefix = "";
00047         }
00048         else
00049         {
00050             pkgPrefix = pkg.getName() + ".";
00051         }
00052     }

synchronized void org::ipdr::collector::log::CollectorLog::logWriteX (  String  level,
String  className,
String  function,
String  msg
)  [inline, protected]
 

The utility for outputting a single message.

Parameters:
level The level ("debug", " info", etc.).
className The class name.
function The function (method).
msg The message. 
00231     {
00232         synchronized (dateISOformat)
00233         {
00234             String classNameFull = className;
00235             if (msg == null)
00236             {
00237                 msg = "";
00238             }
00239             if (function == null)
00240             {
00241                 function = "";
00242             }
00243             if (className == null)
00244             {
00245                 className = "";
00246             }
00247 
00248             String date = dateISOformat.format(new Date());
00249             if (true)
00250             {
00251                 if (className.startsWith(pkgPrefix))
00252                 {
00253                     className = className.substring(pkgPrefix.length());
00254                 }
00255                 // Upper-case first character of message, for consistency.
00256                 if (msg.length() > 0 && Character.isLowerCase(msg.charAt(0)))
00257                 {
00258                     msg = Character.toUpperCase(msg.charAt(0)) + msg.substring(1);
00259                 }
00260                 printerrln(this.linePrefix + ":" + date + " " + // hh:mm:ss --
00261                         // leave date
00262                         // off for
00263                         // compactness
00264                         ((level != INFO_TAG && level != DEBUG_TAG) ? ("[" + level + "] ") : "") + msg + " :: " + function + "[" + className + "] ");
00265             }
00266             else
00267             {
00268                 boolean firstLine = true;
00269                 int offset = 0;
00270                 while (offset < msg.length())
00271                 {
00272                     if (firstLine)
00273                     {
00274                         printerr(linePrefix + date + " " + level + "[" + classNameFull + "." + function + "] thread " + Thread.currentThread().getName());
00275                     }
00276                     else
00277                     {
00278                         printerr(linePrefix + blanksOfLength(date) + " " + blanksOfLength(level) + " " + blanksOfLength(classNameFull) + " "
00279                                 + blanksOfLength(function) + "  thread " + Thread.currentThread().getName());
00280                     }
00281 
00282                     printerr("\t... ");
00283                     int nl = msg.indexOf('\n', offset);
00284                     if (nl < 0)
00285                     {
00286                         printerrln(msg.substring(offset));
00287                         offset = msg.length();
00288                     }
00289                     else
00290                     {
00291                         printerrln(msg.substring(offset, nl - 1));
00292                         offset = nl + 1;
00293                     }
00294                     firstLine = false;
00295                 }
00296             }
00297         }
00298     }

final DateFormat org::ipdr::collector::log::CollectorLog::dateISOformat = IPDRUtilities.factoryDateFormat() [static, private]
 

Date format for generating ISO-format dates (for suitable synchronization)

final String org::ipdr::collector::log::CollectorLog::DEBUG_TAG = "debug" [private]
 

final String org::ipdr::collector::log::CollectorLog::ERROR_TAG = "error" [private]
 

final String org::ipdr::collector::log::CollectorLog::FATAL_TAG = "fatal" [private]
 

final String org::ipdr::collector::log::CollectorLog::INFO_TAG = " info" [private]
 

int org::ipdr::collector::log::CollectorLog::level = 1 [private]
 

The output level (default: info). Values are:
0: debug
1: info
2: warning
3: error
4: fatal a

String org::ipdr::collector::log::CollectorLog::linePrefix [private]
 

Line prefix (handy for things such as the "progress" callback for CollectorSetupManager.

String org::ipdr::collector::log::CollectorLog::pkgPrefix = "" [private]
 

The package prefix to remove from messages. This is set by the constructor to this package's name, followed by "." (e.g., " org.ipdr.collector. ").

final String org::ipdr::collector::log::CollectorLog::WARN_TAG = " warn" [private]
